column3: Looks like this needs a rebase.
Looks good to me too other than what @laanwj pointed out.
Looks like this is ready for merge apart from @sipa's nit...
As you change this initializer to a different style anyway: maybe do the initialization in-line where the field is defined?\n
Just because negation is that obvious? I suspect this is some common coding practice?
Type names ending in `_t` are technically reserved by POSIX, so risk colliding with system types on some architectures.
Good point, I totally forgot that _t was already covered by a naming convention.  Will update.

In several different projects I have worked on this is a standard practice.   It is simpler, less error-prone (in the case where someone updates operator== but forgets to update operator!=) and usually is also a LoC reduction.\n\nThis could be applied in other areas of the codebase as well but I didn't want to scope creep this PR.
